text: ELTON JOHN in a sequined and feathered catsuit storms alo a halo of coloured feathers and enormous stained-glass spectacles. He is a man with a purpose but looks like shi
Elton sits dramatically in the seat and stares confrontationally at the circle of addicts. He sweats profusely.
How long is this going to take?
That’s really up to you. You need to set your own pace..... Everybody stares. Elton is clearly uncomfortable.

Right then! I know how this goes. My name is Elton John. And I’m an alcoholic. And a cocaine addict. And a sex addict. And a bulimic! I’m also a shopaholic who has problems with weed, prescription drugs and anger management. The group look at him incredulously. Elton blinks angrily behind his enormous glasses. An awkward silence.
Perhaps we should talk about your childhood?
Perhaps we should talk about your hair!? Some of the group are shocked and some laugh. The counsel smiles.
What are your earliest memories? Cue: The frantic opening from ‘THE BITCH IS BACK’. Elton up and walks to the middle of the room and sings.  Blue Rev. (07/31/18) White Shooting 2.

I was justified when I was five Raisin’ Cain, I spit in your eye Times are a changing now the poor get fat, But the fever’s gonna catch you when the bitch gets back, oh, oh, oh. The patients and counselor are dumbfounded as out of nowh a child (REGGIE), 6 years old, rides in through the doubl doors on a bike with stabilizers and circles Elton. The y Reggie stops and stares at Elton and joins in the song.

I’m a bitch, I’m a bitch oh, the bitch is back, stone cold sober as a matter of fact, I can bitch, I can bitch cause I’m better than you, It’s the way that I move, the things that I do oh. A shocked Elton tries to grab Reggie as he dumps his bike runs out the door. A singing Elton chases after him, the therapy group and counselor follow behind.

Young Reggie bursts through the doors and enters a 1950's London residential street. Reggie, walks down the middle the street followed by Elton and the rehab group. The milkman, postman and lollipop lady all wave to him. A bra band come marching down the street and they all smile and wave. People stream out of the houses and join in the gro dance. The rehab group, lead by Elton, follow and sing al

Eat meat on a Friday, that’s all right. Even like steak on a Saturday night. I can bitch the best at your social do’s. I get high in the evening sniffing pots of glue, oh, oh oh. It becomes a dance number that Reggie conducts with the r group and the people in the street. Reggie turns into the driveway of a drab house, turns back to the rehab group looking over the fence.
I’m a bitch, I’m a bitch oh, the bitch is back. Stone cold sober as a matter of fact. (MORE )
Blue Rev. (07/31/18) White Shooting 3.

I can bitch, I can bitch cause I’m better than you. It’s the way that I move, the things that I do oh.. Elton looks troubled. The music stops abruptly. SHEILA, his mum, comes out holding a mechanical sweeper.

Reggie! You’re late! I’ve thrown your dinner in the bin! Get inside. Reggie tucks in his shirt and follows his mum into the ho INT. BACK ROOM, REGGIE’S HOUSE - DAY 4 An archetypal suburban scene. IVY, grandma, in the kitche works on a sewing machine. A depressed budgie lolls in it cage. Sheila attacks a carpet with the mechanical sweeper like she’s trying to break it. Reggie follows her around.
Is he back?
What am I? Thin air?
Are you sure he’s actually coming home?
I wouldn’t get your hopes up. He’s very unreliable and very selfish.
But will you send him to see me if I'm already in bed?

Reggie! Stop being a nuisance! I need to get this done before I go out. She picks him up and puts him on the piano stool. The rad plays: The Skater’s Waltz. As dust hangs in the sunlight, Reggie sways to the music looks at the piano keyboard. As it lilts on in the backgr Reggie tries a note - remarkably it is in tune.  White Shooting 4. Reggie plays the note again and then adds two more. Again they are exactly in tune. He looks around. No one pays attention: Reggie tries again and this time plays a whole section of melody and ends with a low note with his left hand. Bong! Suddenly the world seems to stop. The budgie stares froze its perch, boggle eyed. Ivy comes in from the Kitchen. Sh turns around to see what all the fuss is about.
Did I do something wrong? Ivy Bloody hell, Sheila. Maybe we should get him some lessons.
I'd love too, if it’d get him out from under my feet but we’re not made of money.
Elton takes off his feathered head-dress.

Mum always supported me. She knew I was very talented. Both my parents did. INT. BACK ROOM, REGGIE’S HOUSE - NIGHT 6 Sheila paints her nails and gets ready to go out. Ivy sit front of the fire and reads a magazine. The doorbell ring Ivy looks up, Sheila looks pissed off.

Reggie rushes out of his room and listens as Sheila goes the door. I/E. FRONT DOOR, REGGIE’S HOUSE - NIGHT 8 The door opens to reveal STANLEY, Reggie’s dad, dressed immaculately in his RAF uniform. He gives a faint rueful smile to Sheila and Ivy.  Blue Rev. (07/31/18) White Shooting 5.
You've managed to drag yourself home then. Ivy I see the milkman’s back. Hello, Stanley.
How are you, Ivy?
Like you care. Well, come on then! You're letting in a draught. He wipes his very shiny boots and steps inside.
You've put on weight.
And you look shorter. How long you back?
I’ve got couple of weeks leave. Ivy Reggie’s not long gone to bed.
Pop up, say hello.
I'll see him tomorrow. Any dinner left? Stanley walks off into the kitchen. INT. LANDING, REGGIE’S HOUSE - NIGHT 9 In the shadows Reggie is sad and disappointed.
Reggie runs down the street as fast as he can in his scho uniform. He passes all the other local kids playing footb

Oi four eyes! You’re in goal. Reggie ignores them and keeps running.  11 12 White Shooting 6. INT. BACK ROOM, REGGIE’S HOUSE - DAY 11 Reggie, enters home and stares in wonder at his father as takes a jazz record out of it’s sleeve, meticulously clea it with a velvet pad, places it carefully on the turn tab and it starts to play.
Dad, is it true you play the piano? I’m saving to get lessons.

If you want to sit in here you'll have to stay quiet. I’m listening to my music. As Stanley listens to the record Reggie watches him for a moment then goes and gets a record from the shelf and pro presents it to his Dad.
I like this one, Dad, will you play it for me? He leaps up, snatching the record from Reggie.

Who said you could touch those? Never, ever, touch my collection without asking. Stanley carefully puts the record back and turns to look Reggie. Reggie looks at his father then goes in for a hug Stanley doesn’t respond but looks uncomfortable and pushe him off.
Don’t be soft Reggie runs out.
Elton talks to the counselor but is clearly agitated, ang and confrontational with her.

He was always hugging me! It was fucking embarrassing. My dad was passionate about family and music. We'd talk for hours about jazz. I was lucky. I was actually a very happy child.  13 14 15 16 Blue Rev. (07/31/18) White Shooting 7. EXT. GARDEN, REGGIE’S HOUSE - DAY 13 Reggie throws a tantrum and smashes plant pots with a cri bat at the bottom of the garden.
It’s not fair. I hate him. I wish I’d never been born. Shelia, all glammed up wanders down and watches Reggie. Reggie stops and looks at the destruction he’s caused. He looks at Shelia.
What are you doing?

Nothing. Shelia lights a cigarette and puffs thoughtfully. INT. BACK ROOM, REGGIE’S HOUSE - DAY 14 Reggie seated at the piano. His legs dangle over the edge the stool. A PIANO TEACHER is there and Shelia watches fo moment. She takes some slimming pills from her handbag, p a couple and then goes. Reggie learns his scales. INT. CORRIDOR, REGGIE’S HOUSE. NIGHT. 15 A slightly drunk Sheila, walks past Reggie’s room. She se light on and stops. She opens the door and sees Reggie reading music. Reggie looks up, startled.
What are you still doing up?
Learning. I want to play a song for dad.

Your dad’s gone back to his unit. Go to sleep. Sheila turns off the light. INT. REGGIE'S BEDROOM, REGGIE’S HOUSE - NIGHT 16 The door closes. Reggie sits in the darkness. After a mom a torch comes on and Reggie slowly mimes playing the pian  Blue Rev. (07/31/18) White Shooting 8. As he becomes more animated the sound of Tchaikovsky Pian concerto No.1 accompanies him. He stands and points with his torch like a conductor to b in a string section. The shafts of the light wave over th room and we catch glimpses of the orchestra. We hear strings, brass and woodwind join - as Reggie, conducts. The whole orchestra plays. Suddenly the door op and the light goes on. Reggie freezes and looks up, terrified. It’s Ivy. She has 2 cakes. Ivy Take no notice. These will make you feel better. She kisses him and goes out. Reggie takes a bite of the c then raises his hands to start the orchestra again, as we to: INT. BACK ROOM, REGGIE’S HOUSE - DAY 17 Reggie plays the Concerto effortlessly for real. As we pu out we see Reggie is now 12 years old. He finishes the pi with a flourish. The piano teacher smiles. INT. KITCHEN, REGGIE’S HOUSE - EVENING 18 Ivy irons Sheila’s dress. Sheila, her hair in curlers and her underwear, reads Vogue. Reggie is by the back door.
The Royal Academy of Music!? (beat) Pass me those scissors. Reggie brings her the scissors. Sheila cuts out a pattern a skirt.
What d’ya think? She shows him the picture.
The red’s nicer.
Is it?
It’s only on Saturday's.  White Shooting 9.
Saturdays! I’ve things to do on the weekends. I can’t just drop everything. You can go on your own. Ivy smiles at Reggie. Ivy I’ll take you. Make sure you’re settled in.
Thanks, Mum. The immaculately dressed Stanley enters and takes in Shei There is tension and mistrust in the air.
Where are you off too?
Don’t know. I haven’t decided yet but wherever it is I’m going to have fun. Something you old RAF types don’t do. Ivy Reg’s piano teacher thinks he’s good enough to get a scholarship.
Really? Has he got that kind of talent?
Course he has. But you’d know that if you took the slightest bit of interest in me and this family. Sheila goes.

head_text.subj: I/E. ROYAL ACADEMY OF MUSIC, FOYER

text: Ivy stands next to a nervous Reggie, dwarfed by the dusty surroundings. A bearded student pushes past them with a double bass in a case. The place swarms with duffle coate students. Reggie looks around, awed and bewildered as the walk up a grand staircase.
Can we go home?  20 Blue Rev. (07/31/18) White Shooting 10. Ivy Home? There’s no going home! This is it now. This is your life. You have to get over this silly shyness.

But mum says we can’t... Ivy Life gives you very few chances, Reggie. This is one of yours. Show them you’re as good as they are. Better! Be number one. Everyone’s scared in the beginning. Play at being confident. You can do that can’t you?
Yes. Easy. Ivy Good. So go on then. Ivy gives him some change.
There’s enough for a bag of chips and your bus fare home.
Reggie wanders into the room transfixed by the music. HEL PIENA plays a piece by Mozart unaware that he is there. S sees him and stops.
Reginald Dwight?
Yes.
Did you bring something to play?
I didn’t know I had to.
Is there anything you could show me so I can get a sense of where you are up to?

21 White Shooting 11. He sits down, prepares, then plays the opening chord. One note is out. He blushes. He plays it again, this time correctly, then plays the Mozart piece note perfect, then stopping mid-phase exactly where she left off.
Why have you stopped?
That’s as far as you got. Helen looks impressed that Reggie has played it by ear. H beams a cheeky smile, but Helen does not smile back.

You might have a good memory but you have an awful lot of work to do. Keep you wrists and back straight and start again. His smile drops, he realises this is going to be hard wor Helen smiles, she knows she has a real talent on her hand INT. BACK ROOM, REGGIE’S HOUSE - DAY 21 Stanley, Sheila, Ivy and Reggie all sit at the table in formal silence. A roast chicken on the table. Sheila, bored and distracted wants be else where. Reggie starts to tap out his piano scales and crunches on a stic celery.
Hands off the table, Reginald. And stop making all that noise. Sheila scoffs and looks at Reggie like ‘I told you’. An unsure Reggie slowly withdraws his hands. Stanley proceed carve.

Did you know Mozart wrote his first piece of music at the age of 5? Reggie is served last with a very small amount. They eat silence. Sheila pushes her food around the plate. Reggie knows that his family doesn’t work. Ivy sneaks Reggie a p of chicken and winks at him. The intro music starts: ‘I W LOVE’. Stanley gets up from the table and lights his pipe looks out of the window.  22 White Shooting 12.
I want love, but it’s impossible. A man like him, so irresponsible. A man like him is dead in places.
Other men feel liberated. I can’t love, shot full of holes. Don’t feel nothing, I just feel cold. Don’t feel nothing..
«--just old scars. Toughening up around my heart. I want love on my own terms. After everything I’ve learned. Ivy Me, I carry too much baggage. Oh god I’ve seen so much traffic. But I want love...
.--just a different kind.
I want love..
.-won’t break me down.
Won’t brick me up, won’t fence me in.
I want a love, that’ll mean something.
That’s the love I want, I want love.

Sheila fumbles in a car with FRED who wears a draped jack and has a D.A. hair style. He tries to get her buttons Suddenly he stops, shocked. Sheila looks round and sees Reggie by the car window looking at them.
Mum! ?  23 Blue Rev. (07/31/18) White Shooting 13. She winds the window down.
Reggie, what are you doing here? * Snooping around? * Fred breaks the embarrassment and presents his hand to th stunned Reggie.
Pleased to meet you, son. I’ve heard a lot about you. Reggie stares at him.
My name’s Fred. I’m a friend of your mum’s. Reggie looks at Sheila with tears in his eyes then turns runs.
Reggie! INT. REGGIE'S BEDROOM, REGGIE’S HOUSE - NIGHT 23 Reggie sits on his bed. Stanley shouts at Sheila. He is furious and loud.

Too bloody right I’1l go! Good! I’m sick of the sight of you. I puta roof over your head. You’ve wanted for nothing. And this builder is what you want now, is he? Got money has he? You love a pound note. You'd drop your knickers for a quid. You self centered, vain, tramp. + eH HH

Shut up you pig! Get out, just go. Reggie closes his eyes and puts his hands over his ears t drown out the shouting. He starts singing. ‘La, la, la, l la, la...’ as in the start of CROCODILE ROCK.’ Heavy footsteps can be heard on the stairs and along the hallway. Reggie’s door is ajar. He watches the shadow of dad outside his room on the wall. Reggie hopes his Dad wi come in. Stanley turns, hesitates. He’s in two minds. The decides against it and goes down the stairs.  24 White Shooting 14. The front door slams. Close on Reggie’s heartbreak and confusion. He goes to his bedroom window and watches his walk off down the street with his suitcase. He doesn’t lo back. Reggie sits on his bed and starts to cry. Ivy comes and sits in a chair by the window.
He didn’t give me a hug goodbye? Ivy He’s no good at showing affection.

I wish I was somebody else. It’s dark and she lights a cigarette. Ivy I heard a song on the radio today I thought you’d like. Quietly taps her nails on the chair and she starts to gen sing ‘HEARTBREAK HOTEL’.

Since my baby left me. I’ve had a new place to dwell. It’s down on the end of a lonely street. Heartbreak Hotel. My baby’s so lonely my baby’s lonely I could die. Reggie listens. Slowly he stops crying.
Who sings it? She sings on.

Elton has now removed more of his costume and sits in his vest with just the bottom half of his feather suit on. Th rest lies in a crumpled heap on the floor. He looks defla and the anger is gone. His head and voice are low and he cries. His hands shake.
How the fuck do you think I felt!? I was a kid. Heartbroken. People don’t care though, do they? (MORE )
Blue Rev. (07/31/18) White Shooting 15.
Anyway, I'd discovered records and rock'n'roll. That was all I cared about.

And now ladies and gentlemen a rising star of Rock and Roll, all the way from Memphis Tennessee, please welcome Elvis Presley. INT. BACK ROOM, REGGIE’S HOUSE - DAY 25 We cut into a T.V. Elvis’ first appearance on an American T.V. Show. Reggie and Ivy sit on the sofa mesmerized by E as he sings ‘Blue Suede Shoes’. Reggie’s eyes are lit up excitement. *

Reggie takes out an exercise book. It is a diary with sev columns of lists. There is a list of “Tunes Learnt” and n another one “Records to purchase” - He writes carefully i the ‘Elvis Presley’ column - ‘Blue Suede Shoes’. * Fred and Sheila come in from shopping. Sheila turns down t.v.
I got you this while I was out. I know you like him. Sheila pulls out Elvis album from a bag. Reggie can’t bel it.
He’s quite a dish. She holds up the cover of the record and they all gaze at fantastic picture of Elvis in all his glory. Ivy Ooo. I would.
Mum!
Thank you, Mum. It’s fantastic. Reggie slowly takes the record. Transfixed. It is obvious that it is in very safe hands with Reggie.  26 Blue Rev. (07/31/18) White Shooting 16.
Be careful with it.
So - are you serious about wanting to be a rock’n’roller?
Yeah. Course.
Okay, we should get you the proper hair cut then.
Can I get it cut like Elvis?
Course you can.

Enjoy it while it lasts. You’re like my side of the family. You'll be bald as an egg by the time you're twenty. Reggie looks shocked and dismayed. Ivy shakes her head. Sheila exits with the shopping. Ivy And a jacket.
Eh? Ivy He’1l need a proper jacket. Ivy holds up the record with Elvis on the front.
Right.
And shoes.

Reggie is at orchestra rehearsals now dressed in his new shoes, jacket and hair cut. The rest of the kids are all dressed a lot more square. A happy Reggie sticks out like sore thumb. A concerned Helen Piena looks at him.  27 28 White Shooting 17.
A home-made sign in the window say: “Tonight: All meat ra plus Reginald Dwight on piano”

A run down hotel bar. A seedy BARMAN talks into the mic t half empty pub. Sheila, Fred and Ivy are all there with a drink. An old upright piano is on the small stage. A man holds up a bag of meat above his head to a small cheer.

Congratulations to Dave, he wins four pork chops, half a pound of prime mince and a string of sausages. Right, now Sheila and Fred's boy is going to play us a couple of songs on the piano so give him a warm welcome cos he’s only 12 and get’s a bit shy. Reggie Dwight. Reggie wears his quiff on full attention. He’s decidedly nervous as he walks onto the little stage and sits at the piano. Ivy signals her encouragement. There is an instant feedback through the mic. This gets everybody’s attention

Hello. Reggie starts to play ‘STREETS OF LAREDO’. No one is impressed. A bloke puts a pint down on top of the piano a continues to talk loudly to his friend. Reggie is intimid and stops. He looks at Ivy who winks at him and mouths. Ivy Play that one I like.
Excuse me. You can’t put that on there.
Why not?
It‘ll get knocked off. Reggie hits the first chord of ‘SATURDAY NIGHT'S ALRIGHT FIGHTING)’.  29 White Shooting 18.

“It’s getting late have you seen my mates...” As somebody turns to watch Reggie they knock over a woman beer and it spills down the front of a big bloke. He turn and pushes the wrong person which starts a small shoving match, and a fight breaks out. Someone bumps into Fred an turns round and whacks them then turns back to Sheila and puts his arm around her as if nothing has happened. Reggi watches as he plays and gets excited by the atmosphere. A the fight builds so does his playing and energy. He grows into a solid and exciting performer and his singing start push the energy of the fight. People fly across the room, glasses are smashed, chairs are thrown. Reggie sings on.

“Ma tell me when the boys get back here. It’s seven o’clock and I want to rock. Wanna get a belly full of beer” Reggie ducks as a chair flies over the piano. Sheila, Fre and Ivy are in the middle of the chaos with their gin and tonics and still smile encouragingly at Reggie.

“My old man’s drunker than a barrel full of monkey’s. And my old lady she don’t care. My sister looks cute in her braces and her boots. A handful of grease in her hair” Two men, now on top of the piano, fight and Ivy hits them with her handbag. Reggie has to dive this way and that to avoid being hit but plays without missing a beat.

“So don’t give us none of your aggravation. We’ve had it with yer discipline. Saturday night’s alright for fighting. Get a little action in”. Suddenly someone has a chair and is about to crash it dow onto the piano when Reggie leaps out of the window.

Reggie emerges from the pub in the middle of an ally whic runs down. He come out in the street and jumps over the t of cars - he boots someone who tries to attack him, whils of course, singing in perfect time.  30 31 White Shooting 19.

“Get about as oiled as a diesel train. Gonna set this dance alight. Cause Saturday night’s alright for fightin’. Saturday night’s alright, alright, alright”. Reggie escapes by climbing through a hole in a wooden fen REGGIE is now seventeen years old.

Reggie comes out into a huge fun fair with big bright lig and fast moving action. The bumper cars are close by and different gangs hang out here. Teddy boys, rockers, mods, Beatniks, Jamaicans, Indians, mums and dads with their ki All walks of British 60’s life. Reggie runs and ducks thr the legs of the bigger kids as they come together and car on the fight and dance. The bumper cars are packed with people and Reggie laughs as he hangs on to one of the car

“We're packed pretty tight in here tonight. I’m looking for a dolly who’ll see me right. I may use a little muscle to get what I need. I sink a little drink and shout she’s with me..” Reggie jumps off and runs and ducks through another hole the fence.
Reggie runs along the street and a gang of mods on scoote come towards him. He turns and goes the other way as the sing:

“A couple of sounds that we really like. Are the sound of a switchblade and a motorbike. We’re a juvenile product of the working class. Who’s best friend floats in the bottom of a glass”. Reggie flies out of the alley.
“So don’t give us none of your aggravation. We’ve had it with yer discipline”.  32 33 White Shooting 20. Reggie sees the brightly lit pub and dives back in throug the window.

Reggie dives across the bar and lands on the piano stool plays on. He has a band backing him called ‘Bluesology’ a dressed identically. Slim fitted, dark clothes and hush puppies. The pub is half full. Sheila, Fred and Ivy are t and politely clap.

“Saturday night’s alright for fightin’. Get a little action in. Saturday! Saturday! Saturday! Saturday! Saturday! Saturday night’s alright.” The number finishes with a flourish. Everyone cheers. Reg beams back at them.
Reggie and the band BOBBY, CYRIL and ELTON DEAN pack up. tall thin man leans against a wall and smokes. DAVE GODIN
Good show tonight boys. You look like you know how to enjoy yourselves. How would you like to make two quid a week? Each! Elton Dean whistles.
Go on.
Dave Godin, promoter of the soul music review. I’ve got 3 new American acts doing a tour of England and they all need back up.
We’re not a backing band!
What’s soul music?
Music for people who feel it in their heart. (MORE )
Blue Rev. (07/31/18) White Shooting 21.
What I’m looking for is a band that have got music running through their souls. It’s about pain and love and heartbreak.
You what?
Forget all this Rock n Roll stuff. Wilson and the Twilights. The Bluebells. The sound of the future. Your future.
Why don’t they have their own band?
Enough talk! You’re obviously tough negotiators. Three pounds a week plus room and board. Beat. Godin hands Reggie his card and smiles enigmaticall

Think about it. I’1l need to know * by tomorrow lunch time. It’s six * months. So if you’re up for it * swing by the office, pick up the records. You’1ll have a week to * learn twenty songs. Reggie takes the card but a worrying thought comes over Reggie.
Reggie walks along and looks unsure of himself. Other students come and go and some say hello. He nods back but distracted. He stops outside a door, paces for a bit then enters.
Reggie sits next to Helen Piena at the piano.
Why are you so distracted, Reg? The ‘Puccini’ recital is next week. Being an accompanist is very * important and you’re obviously not * practicing.
Blue Rev. (07/31/18) White Shooting 22.
I’m not going to be able to do the recital. My bands been offered six months touring.
You're throwing away all your hard work to dedicate your time to playing rock and roll in dirty pubs? Do you think that’s a good use of your talent?
I don’t want to just play dead people’s music.
I beg your pardon?
Anyway, if Puccini were alive today, he’d be playing rock'n'roll.
You've got a great future here. The Royal Philharmonic is a very real possibility for you. Helen Piena plays the intro Nessun Dorma.
I need to do this. I love rock‘n’roll...

Passion is important, Reggie but think it through. If you give up your place here you won’t be able to just walk back in when things don’t work out. Can you make any money playing this kind of music? There’s no stability in it. I like rock'n'roll to but I wouldn’t gamble my whole future on it. I can’t allow it. Helen plays ‘Nessun Dorma’ as Reggie gets up and walks ou She doesn’t look back but knows he is gone. INT. REGGIE’S BEDROOM, REGGIE’S HOUSE 35A Reggie enters with a stack of records and throws them on bed and sits.  36 Blue Rev. (07/31/18) White Shooting 22a. There is a shelf in the room that has a few records on. Reggie puts the new disks on the shelf. He takes one and reverentially puts it on his record player. Intro music starts for ‘BREAKING DOWN THE WALLS OF HEARTA by THE BLUEBELLS. The song plays over.
Reggie carries his electric keyboards, the rest of the ba load equipment into a van. Godin smokes and the boys are excited as they get in the van.
37 38 39 40 4l 42 43 White Shooting 23.

Montage - as ‘BREAKING DOWN THE WALLS OF HEARTACHE’ carri on: WILSON out front singing like a pro. Reggie plays some gr organ and looks at Wilson doing his thing and the crowd lapping it up. He’s a master at work. Reggie watches his every move, loving it and learning. Wilson is replaced by another great, DIANA and the BLUEBELLS all in beautiful t fitting gold dresses. Again Reggie watches in awe from be the keyboard.
Reggie and the rest of the band are crammed in at the bac They are happy and the energy is high. The laugh and smok
Reggie on stage with the band. The TWILIGHTS sing and dan Reggie is at the back but he and the band all enjoy playi One of the singers, RICHARD smiles and winks at Reggie an smiles back.

In the corridor leading to the stage, Reggie passes Wilso dressing room and sees through the door. Wilson is being injected with heroin in his arm by his girlfriend. Wilson sees Reggie, smiles and nods at him. INT. STAGE - NIGHT Al On stage Reggie plays while he watches Wilson sing. He wo hard and sweat runs down his face and back. His shirt is soaked through.
Reggie packs away his organ as the other guys are surroun by dolly birds. Richard takes off his shirt and Reggie st at him. Richard catches him looking and holds Reggie’s ey

Reggie and the guys are all dressed differently and now h more shinny suits on.  44 45 46 47 Blue Rev. (07/31/18) White Shooting 24. They smoke and drink and are growing up fast. Bobby hands some pills which they all take.
They are all in different costumes. The Bluebells sing.
Reggie waits to go on. Richard comes up to him and they w The Bluebells perform for a bit. As the girls finish Rich turns to Reggie and suddenly kisses him on the lips on qu a sensual way.
Have a good show. Reggie is in shock by the thrill he has just experienced.

Thank you. Richard laughs and walks out on stage. INT. REGGIE'S BEDROOM, REGGIE’S HOUSE - NIGHT 46 Reggie puts some records on the shelves which are much fuller. He flops down on his bed and stares at the ceilin
Reggie and Wilson sit next to each other nursing drinks. other American acts, Godin and the rest of Bluesology dri and laugh with girls they’ve picked up.
What’s up, Reggie? Reggie watches them and broods.
How does a fat boy with glasses from Pinner, called Reggie Dwight get to be a soul man?
Write some songs.
Easier said than done.  48 49 50 Blue Rev. (07/31/18) White Shooting 25.
Of course it is. Every song I write is part of me. What’s in your heart when you play?
Dunno - everything. It’s where I feel I’m not alone.
There you go. Real poetic, kid. Set that to music. Wilson considers Reggie for a moment.
I'm a skinny, black, kid from Detroit who’s real name is Rodney Jones. I played roadside joints for ten years before I realised what I had to do.
What? Change your name?
Not just your name. You have to kill the person you’re born to be in order become the person you want to be.
